item.title: STEM Career Prediction
item.description: STEM is an abbreviation of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math. In recent years, there has been a constant increase in the demand for STEM-related workforce. Moreover, there is a large number of students that lose interest in STEM early or are not fully prepared to participate in these fields. In this context, the team behind the ASSISTments intelligent tutoring system conducted a longitudinal study that led to a data mining competition. Participants are requested to predict which students will pursue a STEM career using data from their interactions with the ASSISTments ITS. In this competition, I won second place and shared my findings in different papers submitted to the educational data mining conference and journal.

item.title: Analysis of Click-Stream Data to Predict STEM Careers from Student Usage of an Intelligent Tutoring System
Investigating How School Aggregated Data Can Influence in Predicting STEM Career from Student usage of an Intelligent Tutoring System
Predicting if students will pursue a STEM career using School Aggregated Data from their usage of an Intelligent Tutoring System
